events.title: The 2024 presidential alternative many voters will want
Why isn't the House Judiciary Committee looking into Thomas?
events.summary: On Monday, the GOP-controlled House Judiciary Committee — chaired by Donald Trump ally Rep. Jim Jordan — is set to hold a field hearing in New York City called "Victims of Violent Crime in Manhattan." A statement bills the hearing as an examination of how, the Judiciary Committee says, Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg's policies have "led to an increase in violent crime and a dangerous community for New York City residents."

events.title: Top secrets come spilling out
events.summary: In 1917, British analysts deciphered a coded message the German foreign minister sent to one of his country's diplomats vowing to begin "unrestricted submarine warfare" and seeking to win over Mexico with a promise to "reconquer the lost territory in Texas, New Mexico and Arizona" if the US entered the world war. When it became public, the Zimmerman Telegram caused a sensation, helping propel the US into the conflict against Germany.

events.title: How did Sudan go from casting off despotic rule to this?
events.summary: Four years ago, almost to the day, the people of Sudan were celebrating a revolution after overthrowing longtime dictator Omar al-Bashir. Now the East African country faces the possibility of a complete collapse similar to the chaos we see today in Yemen or Libya.

events.title: Michelle Yeoh set to return in new 'Star Trek' movie
events.summary: Live long and prosper, Michelle Yeoh.

events.title: Recap: 'Succession' finds dark humor in the aftershocks
events.summary: After the shock came the aftershocks, the power vacuum, and perhaps most significantly and impressively, the laughs, as "Succession" pivoted to face life after Logan Roy, in an episode that finally put the HBO show's title into full flower.

events.title: 'Yellowjackets' leans hard into '90s music nostalgia, and we're here for it
events.summary: Of the many dark gifts Showtime's eerie hit series "Yellowjackets" serves up for us, the juiciest this season is by far the music.

events.title: Jeremy Renner revisits 'the amazing group of people' who helped him recover from his accident
events.summary: Jeremy Renner is continuing his recovery after his devastating snowplow accident in January, and recognizing those who've helped him along the way.

events.title: Review: 'Barry' takes a whack at its farewell season
events.summary: "Barry" has taken chances from the very beginning, which is certainly true of a fourth and final season that picks up where the third left off, with its hitman-turned-wannabe actor getting arrested. That paves the way for an even darker season that accentuates the show's ensemble aspect while leaning a little too heavily on blurring lines with flights of fancy.

events.title: The Uplift: The Sunrise Guy
events.summary: A Holocaust survivor and a teenage boy form a bond while working together. A Michigan man earns the title of "Sunrise Guy" for his passion for waking up with the sun to take photographs. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: The Uplift: Carter's commitment
events.summary: We look back at former President Jimmy Carter's commitment to Habitat for Humanity and meet a woman who still lives in a so-called "Carter Home" in Baltimore that the late president helped build more than 30 years ago. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: The Uplift: Save the Swamp
events.summary: The story of one man's mission to save a beloved Georgia swamp. A 17-year-old makes history by accomplishing a daring feat with the support of her dad. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: The Uplift: Michael Jordan's Home Court
events.summary: A group of lucky basketball players get a chance to play on Michael Jordan's home court inside his former house. A family decides to move to a remote island and Steve Hartman explains why. Plus, more heartwarming stories.

events.title: The Uplift: Honoring dads
events.summary: Two siblings work to honor their late father by getting a word he made up into the dictionary. Also, David Begnaud introduces us to a dad and Stanford professor using his own cancer diagnosis to teach his medical students and inspire countless people. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: The Uplift: The "wow kid"
events.summary: An orchestra's performance receives a surprising reaction from a young boy in the audience – and the single word he uttered made a major impact. Plus, how a Google spreadsheet is helping victims of the California wildfires.

events.title: The Uplift: Finding purpose
events.summary: David Begnaud introduces us to three different people who found their purpose in life. One, a custodian working to become a teacher. The other, a young woman who used her medical diagnosis to help others. The third, a man who is a so-called medical marvel. Plus, Lisa Ling sits down with Margaret Cho and Joel Kim Booster to talk comedy and the power of representation.

events.title: The Uplift: A noble life
events.summary: David Begnaud looks at the legacy of Gayle Noble, a California woman known for her random acts of kindness. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: The Uplift: Christina's Corner
events.summary: A video store owner in Idaho makes sure his most loyal customer, a woman with Down Syndrome, doesn't miss his store after he decided to close his shop. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: The Uplift: Field of dreams
events.summary: An Iowa farmer turns his field into a tennis stadium that rivals Wimbledon and attracts players from around the country, including a grand slam winner. Plus, more heartwarming stories.

events.title: The Uplift: National Teachers Hall of Fame
events.summary: David Begnaud traveled the country to meet teachers who not only helped kids in the classroom — but left a lasting impression on their hearts, earning them a spot in the 2025 National Teachers Hall of Fame. Plus, more good news and heartwarming stories.

events.title: The Uplift: Tiny, terrific towns
events.summary: David Begnaud introduces us to a young man travels to tiny towns across the U.S. to highlight what makes them terrific. Plus, we catch up with a man who had dream of flying as a teen – now, he's taking to the skies.

events.title: The Uplift: A kingly grad
events.summary: A recent graduate leaves his commencement ceremony for his place of work, Burger King, and ends up helping out his coworkers - while still in his graduation gown. Now, he's being honored for his selfless act.

events.title: The Uplift: Dermot Mulroney
events.summary: Actor Dermot Mulroney introduces us to Stick Nation -- a group that helps us find our inner child. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: 12/20: The Uplift
events.summary: Visit a Uyghur restaurant in Southern California, where culture is shared and the food is made with love. Plus, a man who wanted to save his friends life by donating a kidney ends up saving his own life.

events.title: The Uplift: A Dynamic Duo
events.summary: A man with cerebral palsy and his racing partner attempt to complete six Abbott World Marathon Majors, with one left: Tokyo. David Begnaud has an update on Trooper the dog, who was rescued after being abandoned ahead of Hurricane Milton. Plus, a behind the scenes look at the Girl Scouts' cookie operation.

events.title: The Uplift: Gus Walz
events.summary: David Begnaud sits down with Gus Walz, the son of Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, whose emotional reaction to his dad at the DNC went viral. Gus opens up about his nonverbal learning disorder in his first ever interview.

events.title: The Uplift: Doctor hero
events.summary: A Baltimore doctor who doesn't charge his patients realizes it's those patients who have made him a rich man with their generosity towards him. A man who was a refugee from Central Africa builds a new life in the United States as a police officer, author and father. Plus, more good news.

events.title: The Uplift: A diamond in the rough
events.summary: A couple returns to their Altadena house after the Los Angeles fires to find a meaningful gem. A man with cerebral palsy and his wife share their love story – and the full life they have led together. Plus, David Begnaud has three good news stories.

events.title: The Uplift: The greatest place in the world
events.summary: Visit one of "the world's greatest places," according to Time Magazine. Plus, meet a little girl using jokes to raise money for a cause close to her heart.

events.title: The Uplift: Jimmy Butler
events.summary: NBA star Jimmy Butler has a new side hustle: being a barista. How his side gig selling cups of joe to fellow NBA players turned into a business. Plus, a woman shares how her grandfather's cat inspired her to start a nonprofit that helps animals and pet owners in need.

events.title: The Uplift: Hero dad
events.summary: David Begnaud introduces us to a father who became his son's hero, just by being himself. Plus, Steve Hartman shares a lesson on humility and we take a look at the job of guarding the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

events.title: The Uplift: The power of music
events.summary: This episode of the Uplift is dedicated to the power of music and how it can bring strangers together, strengthen existing bonds and spread joy. A performer surprises her former music teacher with a custom song. A group of high school singers gather to carry on a time honored tradition of singing the national anthem. Plus, more good news stories.

events.title: The Uplift: The eagles have landed
events.summary: Two beloved bald eagles named Jackie and Shadow received global attention as they awaited the hatching of their eaglets in Big Bear, California. David Begnaud introduces us to a girl who raised funds to obtain a prosthetic limb called the Hero Arm – and in the process, she became a hero to others. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: 12/6: The Uplift
events.summary: A pint-sized politician proves you are never too little to run a big campaign. David Begnaud catches up with the Agars, a father-son duo making history by competing together in triathlons. Plus, more heartwarming stories.

events.title: The Uplift: An interview with the president
events.summary: An 11-year-old nabbed an interview with President Bill Clinton when he was in sixth grade – but how? Decades later, he shares how his determination landed him in the seat across from the president, which is still inspiring others today. Plus, more heartwarming news.

events.title: The Uplift: A chance encounter
events.summary: David Begnaud had a chance encounter with a 102-year-old woman at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport, and she shared with him her lessons on life. Three young siblings teach us a lesson about grief and how they overcame the complicated emotion when their beloved labradoodle died. Plus, more heartwarming stories.

events.title: The Uplift: An ode to New York City
events.summary: Meet the man running the "Humans of New York" project, a photo series that profiles everyday people on the streets of the Big Apple. But who is behind the camera? It's Brandon Stanton, who has a new project in the works as a way that shows his love for the city. Plus, more uplifting news.

events.title: "Like a horror movie": Survivors, witnesses describe Swiss ski resort fire
events.summary: As a deadly fire tore through the Le Constellation bar in the Swiss ski town of Crans-Montana, young people trapped inside tried desperately to escape.

events.title: Fire kills dozens at crowded Swiss Alps bar on New Year's
events.summary: Police in Switzerland say a fire at a bar in the Crans-Montana ski resort area is believed to have left about 40 people dead and dozens more injured.

events.title: Mamdani’s rise reflected in Muslim neighborhood that was targeted after 9/11
events.summary: New York Muslims were subjected to surveillance and fear after 9/11. Now, many welcome the mayorship of Zohran Mamdani, the city’s first Muslim mayor.

events.title: My year covering the historic start of Trump 2.0
events.summary: Our White House correspondent reflects on a momentous and tumultuous year covering a president determined to flex his power, shake up the federal bureaucracy, and leave his mark on the nation’s capital.

events.title: Trump says Ukraine-Russia peace ‘closer than ever’ after talks with Zelenskyy
events.summary: President Donald Trump says Ukraine and Russia are “closer than ever before” to a peace deal, even as Russia launched another round of attacks on Ukraine while Ukrainian President Volodomyr Zelenskyy flew to the United States.

events.title: ‘The best reporting assignment of my year.’ A journalist finds joy in Japan.
events.summary: Education reporter Ira Porter covered a range of issues in 2025 – a year that saw U.S. colleges and universities go head-to-head with the government over funding. His favorite assignment? One that took him to Japan, to explore the influence of studying abroad on Black men.

events.title: With ‘blockade’ against tankers, Trump escalates Venezuela standoff
events.summary: Efforts to stop Venezuela’s oil exports signal that U.S. goals go beyond the narcotics trade to include pressure on the Maduro regime.

events.title: What comes after Trump? Turning Point USA endorses Vance amid party discord.
events.summary: Erika Kirk, leader of the conservative youth organization Turning Point USA, endorsed Vice President JD Vance as the Republican nominee for the 2028 presidential election during the group's annual AmericaFest convention. Talk of future campaigns is complicated by President Donald Trump's occasional musings about seeking a third term.

events.title: How the Lumbee Tribe earned federal recognition after a decadeslong effort
events.summary: The Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina, with more than 55,000 members, earned federal recognition from Congress after decades of attempts. The status will open more government benefits for tribal members and fulfills a campaign promise by President Donald Trump.

events.title: Foiled LA terror plot highlights ‘mishmash’ of beliefs that can fuel violence
events.summary: Experts say a thwarted New Year’s Eve attack in the Los Angeles area shows politically-motivated violence isn’t confined to a “pure ideology.”

events.title: The next step was citizenship. Then these immigrants were pulled out of line.
events.summary: In Boston and other cities, some lawful permanent residents are having their naturalization ceremonies canceled, amid a Trump administration review of applicants from 19 countries identified as posing high security risks.

events.title: After strike on American troops, what’s next for the US in Syria?
events.summary: After three Americans were killed, President Donald Trump threatened retaliation. How a U.S. response might impact the new U.S.-Syria partnership.

events.title: Many in Cuban diaspora find anti-Castro soulmate in Marco Rubio
events.summary: Under President Trump, U.S. policy in Latin America has shifted toward more military action. The move is welcomed by many in the Cuban diaspora.

events.title: Most schools are wary of AI. This one is embracing it.
events.summary: Teachers are grappling with how to incorporate artificial intelligence into education. A handful of schools are structuring their programs around the new technology, including a charter school in Hawaii which offers a paradigm shift around AI’s role.

events.title: For California, a first: Formal role for public in fire-recovery policymaking
events.summary: Participants in California's deliberative democracy model prioritized permitting, resilience and financial support as foundations of fire recovery.

events.title: No one has faced trial for 2020 ‘fake electors’ plan. In Wisconsin, it might happen.
events.summary: Criminal cases over a “fake elector” scheme to keep Donald Trump in office after his 2020 election loss have mostly run aground. In Wisconsin, a case involving three key figures in the effort might be headed for trial.

events.title: As inflation weighs on voters, Trump is paying a high price, too
events.summary: With his approval rating for economic leadership dropping in polls, President Trump has tried to downplay voters’ concerns about affordability. The same problem that tripped up Joe Biden is now dogging Mr. Trump.

events.title: Texas Senate race sets up moderates vs. fighters – in both parties
events.summary: It’s been a big month for politics in Texas, after the Supreme Court approved redistricted congressional maps and top candidates solidified running plans. The Senate race emerged as a marquee race with distinct choices in both the Democratic and GOP primaries.

events.title: Only 2% of US students who study abroad are Black men. Meet Tremaine Collins, of Tokyo.
events.summary: Study abroad benefits can be life-changing, in terms of retention, economic capital, and upward mobility. So why do so few Black men get that opportunity?

events.title: Tracking pandemic aid fraud: Five years on, the toll continues to grow
events.summary: A high-profile fraud case in Minnesota has spotlighted the lack of safeguards during the COVID-19 pandemic surrounding funds intended to prop up vulnerable Americans. The looting of taxpayer dollars holds lessons about the social safety net and the federal bureaucracy that oversees it.

events.title: Congress considers ban on member stock trades, going beyond transparency
events.summary: Some in Congress want to ban members from trading in stocks to counter possible insider trading. At present, the rules mostly cover disclosure issues.

events.title: How Trump’s use of pardon power is breaking the mold
events.summary: President Trump has expanded the use of pardons in his second term. Critics say some of his clemency grants could amount to a threat to democracy.

events.title: Fire at Swiss Ski Resort Bar Leaves About 40 People Killed
events.summary: Authorities say about 40 people were killed and more than 100 injured after a deadly fire at a New Year’s celebration in the Swiss Alps. Swiss officials say the fire caused a sudden explosive ignition. The exact cause of the blaze is under investigation. NBC's Daniele Hamamdjian reports for TODAY.

events.title: Trump Says US Will Intervene if Iran Kills Peaceful Protesters
events.summary: President Donald Trump threatened to intervene if Iran shoots or violently kills peaceful protestors amid recent economic protests that have been growing in the region and have turned deadly. NBC’s Gabe Gutierrez reports for TODAY.

events.title: Will Smith sued over allegations he retaliated against violinist who reported sexual harassment
events.summary: A violinist accused Will Smith of retaliation after he said he was fired for reporting sexual harassment while on tour with the actor and rapper, according to a lawsuit filed earlier this week

events.title: A legendary coach retired. Two years later, Nick Saban's influence still rules college football.
events.summary: Hours before a College Football Playoff quarterfinal began Thursday, 74-year-old Nick Saban sat on an ESPN stage constructed inside the Rose Bowl, in the corner of an end zone, in Pasadena, California.

events.title: Trump speaks out about his health
events.summary: In an interview with the Wall Street Journal, President Trump gave his most extensive comments about his health ever. He said he takes 325 milligrams of aspirin a day. He says he has ignored doctors’ advice to lower his dosage because he’s been taking the same dose for 25 years and is “superstitious”. After originally saying he had an MRI in October, the president now says he had a CT scan. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez reports.

events.title: Here’s What to Expect in Medical Innovations for 2026
events.summary: From GLP-1 clinical trials to new advancements for breast cancer, NBC medical contributor Dr. Natalie Azar joins TODAY to discuss the medical innovations set to shape 2026.

events.title: Zohran Mamdani Officially Sworn in as New York City Mayor
events.summary: Zohran Mamdani was officially sworn in on Thursday as mayor of New York City. He is the city’s first Muslim mayor and took the oath with his hand on two Qurans. The 34-year-old Democratic socialist vowed to govern “expansively and audaciously” and campaigned on an agenda aimed at lowering costs for New Yorkers.

events.title: Obamacare premiums could double as subsidies expire
events.summary: Obamacare premiums could double as subsidies expire

events.title: Around 40 dead and 115 injured after fire sweeps through Swiss ski resort bar
events.summary: Around 40 people are dead and around 115 others were severely injured after a fire broke out during a New Year’s Eve celebration at a bar in a Swiss Alps resort, authorities said Thursday

events.title: Trump threatens to intervene if Iran kills peaceful protesters
events.summary: President Donald Trump vowed Friday to intervene if Iran shoots or violently kills peaceful demonstrators, as economic protests spread and evolved into deadly unrest

events.title: About 40 people killed in Swiss Alps resort fire
events.summary: About 40 people were killed and more than 100 injured after a fire broke out at a bar at a popular Swiss Alps ski resort town on New Year's Eve, according to police. The president of the Swiss Confederation, Guy Parmelin, said that many of the victims were young people and include Swiss residents as well as tourists from neighboring countries and elsewhere.

events.title: Dozens presumed dead after fire rips through Swiss ski resort bar
events.summary: Dozens of people are feared dead after a fire swept through a ski resort bar during a New Year’s celebration in Crans-Montana, Switzerland. NBC News’ Daniele Hamamdjian has the details.

events.title: Search for suspects in brazen German bank heist
events.summary: The manhunt is on for the thieves in Germany who police say are responsible for stealing money, jewelry and valuables from a bank on Monday. The heist was the work of professionals, according to authorities. NBC News’ Daniele Hamamdjian has the latest.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Welcome, 2026! Here are the landmark events that will happen in the new year.
events.summary: This new year will be filled with milestones, including America’s 250th birthday, the world’s greatest sports competitions and a mission to the moon.

events.title: How Japan is fighting back against a surge of bear attacks
events.summary: ODATE, Japan — Before students can come out to play at his school, Yoji Hikage has to give the all clear.

events.title: At Gaza's only animal shelter, workers share what food they have with hungry dogs and cats
events.summary: A humble shelter operating out of a tent remains the last beacon of hope for the injured and hungry animal population in war-ravaged Gaza, even as its workers and volunteers face their own impossible conditions.“You cannot look at a creature that trusts you and eat in front of it without sharing,” Saeed Al-Aar, who founded the Sulala Animal Rescue shelter in 2006, told NBC News last month

events.title: A murder, a manhunt and the grandmother who wouldn't stop the search for her daughter's killer
events.summary: Josephine Wentzel spent years tracking down the suspect in her daughter’s death and is now helping others grieving cold cases.

events.title: What we know about the Swiss ski resort fire
events.summary: Details are beginning to emerge about the fire that eruopted at the Constellation Bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana on New Year's Day.

events.title: Russia rings in new year with mass drone strike on Ukraine, Putin says he's confident of victory
events.summary: Russia launched more than 200 drones at Ukraine as new year struck, while Putin and Zelenskyy offered messages to their nations.

events.title: World rings in 2026 and closes out a year marked by Trump, a new pope and fragile truces
events.summary: The world is waving goodbye to 2025 and ringing in 2026 with fireworks from Auckland and Sydney to London and New York.

events.title: U.S. finds Ukraine did not try to kill Putin in alleged drone strike, source says
events.summary: A CIA assessment has concluded that Ukraine did not try to kill Russian President Vladimir Putin at his country residence as alleged by the Kremlin, a source with knowledge of the matter told NBC News

events.title: Eyewitnesses describe mysterious explosion in northwest Venezuela
events.summary: A firsthand account of an explosion along the Venezuelan coast on Dec. 18 is raising questions about who may have been responsible for the attack and whether it was connected to the U.S.’ escalating pressure campaign against the South American country

events.title: Alleged drone attack on a Putin residence offers the Kremlin a timely narrative shift
events.summary: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting one Putin's presidential palaces with drones in a bid to disrupt peace talks. Analysts say it may have been engineered.

events.title: Search for missing Malaysia Airlines flight resumes, reviving hope of answers after more than a decade
events.summary: The search for the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is set to resume Tuesday, more than a decade after the plane went missing with 239 people onboard in one of the world’s greatest aviation mysteries.

events.title: Protests erupt in Iran as prices surge and currency hits new low
events.summary: Iran is facing its largest demonstrations in years as people hit the streets of Tehran and other cities to protest the country's dismal economic situation

events.title: Trump warns Iran and Hamas after meeting with Netanyahu
events.summary: The bilateral meeting with the Israeli prime minister at Mar-a-Lago comes as Trump seeks to advance the Gaza ceasefire deal that he brokered.

events.title: China fires a warning to the U.S. and simulates blockade of Taiwan
events.summary: China fired rockets, massed assault ships and flew bombers around Taiwan on Tuesday, simulating a military blockade in a warning to the United States against supporting the Beijing-claimed island.

events.title: Boxer Anthony Joshua injured in car crash that killed 2 in Nigeria
events.summary: British heavyweight and Olympic gold medalist Anthony Joshua was in a speeding Lexus and survived a crash Monday morning in Nigeria that killed two other people, authorities said

events.title: Russia threatens Ukraine after alleged attack on Putin's residence
events.summary: Russia on Monday promised to retaliate against Ukraine after it said nearly 100 drones had targeted one of President Vladimir Putin's residences, likely throwing a wrench into President Donald Trump’s efforts to end the nearly four-year war."Such reckless actions will not go unanswered.

events.title: As Trump and Zelenskyy meet in Florida, Kyiv hopes this time will be different
events.summary: President Donald Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy return to the negotiating room on Sunday with a familiar, fraught task: trying to chart a path toward ending Russia’s war against Ukraine.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot, French actor and animal rights activist, dies at 91
events.summary: Screen siren Brigitte Bardot, whose portrayals of free-spirited ingenues made her an international sex symbol and the pride of France, and who turned her back on movie stardom in 1973 to become an animal rights activist, has died, according to French media and The Associated Press

events.title: Security guarantees remain critical issue ahead of Zelenskyy's meeting with Trump
events.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is en route to the U.S. via Canada ahead of a weekend of high-stakes diplomacy and a renewed push for peace amid deadly Russian bombing on Ukraine’s capital
